arts.ttl: Exeter City battle hard as Grecians snatch last-gasp point
arts.sum: It had looked like it was going to be a fourth defeat in a row for the Grecians, before Millenic Alli scored the rebound of his saved penalty to salvage a late 1-1 draw. Exeter City ended their three game League One losing run as they snatched a late point away to Peterborough United.

arts.ttl: Peterborough United 1 Exeter City 1 - Grecians snatch 90th equaliser for a point - Devon Live
arts.sum: The Grecians created little of note as a solitary first half goal looked like being enough for Posh to claim the three points, until Millenic Alli’s 90 th minute goal made it 1-1. And they finally took one with 34 minutes gone when a flowing team move was finished off by Hector Kyrpianou’s first time effort for his second goal of the season.

arts.ttl: Millenic Alli snatches point for Exeter with last-gasp equaliser at Peterborough
arts.sum: Hector Kyprianou looked to have given Posh their first league victory in seven games, but Millenic Alli scored the rebound of his saved penalty.

arts.ttl: Exeter City players bravery praised after getting racist abuse
arts.sum: EXETER City manager Gary Caldwell has commended the bravery of striker Josh Magennis and midfielder Caleb Watts, who have both highlighted incidents of late, where they were racially abused. He is alleged to have received racial abuse on social media, following City’s 1-0 defeat at Birmingham City on Saturday, which led to the club releasing a strongly worded statement that read: “ Exeter City FC is appalled by the racist abuse sent to Caleb Watts on social media.

arts.ttl: Exeter City want four more signings before transfer window closes
arts.sum: “It’s a fantastic model and we use it to an extent ourselves with our Academy players and they are probably having a transitional period where younger players are coming in and they will need some time to get up to speed, but on their day, they are still a very dangerous team. “We are looking, speaking and trying and a window that was meant to be quiet has got a lot busier and like I said, we knew this might happen, so we are looking at the contingency plans we have in place.

arts.ttl: Exeter City left deflated after defeat at Birmingham City
arts.sum: Exeter City defender Jack Fitzwater said the Grecians squad were left deflated after their 1-0 defeat to Birmingham City. “We are quite deflated,” Fitzwater said.

arts.ttl: Exeter City Women drop points in Gwalia United draw
arts.sum: The visitors finished the first 45 on top though, with Scahill and Taylor both having shots saved by Bond as City went into the break looking for answers. That was converted past Abbi Bond and despite a battling performance, the Grecians couldn't break down a stubborn Gwalia defence and had to settle for a point.
